pullRequest.body:
The goal is to show that a degree 2 or 3 polynomial is irreducible iff it doesn't have roots. We already have `Polynomial.Monic.irreducible_iff_natDegree'` and some existing results in Lean 3: https://github.com/lean-forward/class-group-and-mordell-equation/blob/main/src/number_theory/assorted_lemmas.lean#L254 and the main work is to connect these bits together.

I added a few helper lemmas about the "monicization" of a polynomial `p`, `p * C (leadingCoeff p)⁻¹`. Then I used these to show the `Polynomial.Monic.irreducible_iff ...` statements could be translated to (not necessarily monic) polynomials over a field, then I specialized these results to the degree-{2,3} case.

I created a new file because I couldn't find an obvious place that imported both `Polynomial.FieldDivision` and `Tactic.IntervalCases`.

Zulip discussion: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/113489-new-members/topic/Polynomial.20irreducible


---

A couple of comments but LGTM, thanks!

bors d+

These could be split into [not_isUnit_of_not_isUnit_dvd](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Divisibility/Units.html#not_isUnit_of_not_isUnit_dvd) and `(nat)degree_pos_of_monic_of_not_isUnit`.
```suggestion
theorem degree_pos_of_not_isUnit_of_dvd_monic {a p : R[X]} (ha : ¬ IsUnit a)
    (hap : a ∣ p) (hp : Monic p) :
    0 < degree a :=
  lt_of_not_ge <| fun h => ha <| by
    rw [Polynomial.eq_C_of_degree_le_zero h] at hap ⊢
    simpa [hp.C_dvd_iff_isUnit, isUnit_C] using hap

theorem natDegree_pos_of_not_isUnit_of_dvd_monic {a p : R[X]} (ha : ¬ IsUnit a)
    (hap : a ∣ p) (hp : Monic p) :
```

> These could be split into [not_isUnit_of_not_isUnit_dvd](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Divisibility/Units.html#not_isUnit_of_not_isUnit_dvd) and `(nat)degree_pos_of_monic_of_not_isUnit`.

That seems to go the wrong way: I interpreted your proposed statement as:
```lean
theorem degree_pos_of_monic_of_not_isUnit {a : R[X]} (hu : ¬ IsUnit a) (ha : Monic a) :
    0 < degree a :=
```
but trying to apply [`not_isUnit_of_not_isUnit_dvd`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Divisibility/Units.html#not_isUnit_of_not_isUnit_dvd) here would give that `p` is not a unit. Rather, this is the specialization of `degree_pos_of_not_isUnit_of_dvd_monic` to the case where `a = p`.

I'll add the results you proposed as a special case of `(nat)degree_pos_of_not_isUnit_of_dvd_monic`.
I see, you're right!

This could be deduced from the first theorem [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/113489-new-members/topic/.E2.9C.94.20Polynomial.20irreducible/near/412616130) on Zulip, and could be strengthened to `degree q <= degree p / 2`.

This is almost the same as the first theorem on Zulip, except p isn't required to be monic. I don't think it makes much sense to remove `Monic` from the right-hand side; this is meant to be an irreducibility criterion, and weakening the RHS only makes it easier to check. If we have that p is irreducible is start with, and q divides p, we know q is a unit or associated to p, so its degree is either 0 or degree p, which we can state as a separate lemma if it looks useful.
I'll restate it in terms of your first theorem, adding the monicity condition.
Please add the second theorem from Zulip and deduce this from it.

I think these lemmas should go into a CommSemiring section rather than CommRing, and
```suggestion
   (·.map C).dvd⟩
```
should work here (if you like it)
This section is actually duplicate with some results at the start of `FieldDivision`. Let me consolidate them here (higher up the import hierarchy).

This is more generally true if `IsReduced R`, the proof should be very easy using [Polynomial.isUnit_iff_coeff_isUnit_isNilpotent](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Polynomial/Nilpotent.html#Polynomial.isUnit_iff_coeff_isUnit_isNilpotent) (but it requires more imports).
Since these results end up not being used elsewhere, I'll move them to another file.

Actually the generality seems incomparable: here we are in a `Semiring` that has `NoZeroDivisors` and `isUnit_iff_coeff_isUnit_isNilpotent` requires `CommRing`. Let me see if I can do a direct proof from `IsReduced`.
@riccardobrasca I don't see how to relax the (commutative) ring condition for the `IsReduced` case, do you know?

> @riccardobrasca I don't see how to relax the (commutative) ring condition for the `IsReduced` case, do you know?

Ah sorry, I automatically thought about `CommRing`. I guess we don't care about a super general result for `Semiring`, so let's just keep as it is.

Even though one direction of [Polynomial.isUnit_iff_coeff_isUnit_isNilpotent](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Polynomial/Nilpotent.html#Polynomial.isUnit_iff_coeff_isUnit_isNilpotent) doesn't generalize to CommSemirings, [Polynomial.coeff_isUnit_isNilpotent_of_isUnit](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Polynomial/Nilpotent.html#Polynomial.coeff_isUnit_isNilpotent_of_isUnit) does generalize and is sufficient to prove `not_isUnit_of_degree_pos` for reduced rings. The original proof doesn't quite work: it still suffices to show that the coefficients lie in every prime ideal, but you can't necessarily take the quotient by an ideal in a semiring and then argue in the resulting domain.

My proof is inspired by [this answer](https://math.stackexchange.com/a/392604/12932), which shows if f is a unit and not a constant then its highest coefficient is nilpotent, and by induction on degree we just need to show f.eraseLead is also a unit. This follow from the general fact that if f+g is a unit and g is nilpotent in a CommSemiring, then f is a unit, with inverse given by $u=\sum\nolimits_{n=0}^{m-1} g^n v^{n+1}$, where v is the inverse of f+g and m is such that $g^m=0$. You can verify fu=1 by adding $g^m v^m=0$ to the end of $\sum\nolimits_{n=0}^{m-1}fg^n v^{n+1}$ and keep cancelling $f+g$ with $v$ until only one term (1) is left.

Some fun exercises that seem to missing in mathlib include: if a+b=0 in a CommSemiring then a^2=b^2, and if moreover a^n=0, then b^n=0.

cc @XavierXarles since he's interested in semirings ...

> Some fun exercises that seem to missing in mathlib include: if a+b=0 in a CommSemiring then a^2=b^2, and if moreover a^n=0, then b^n=0.

And this implies that if a+b=0 and b is nilpotent, then a is also nilpotent. More generally, if (a+b)^n=0 we can expand to get a^n+bx=0, and if b is nilpotent, then bx is nilpotent, so a^n, and therefore a, are nilpotent too. In summary, if (a+b) and b are nilpotent then so is a.

This can be used to generalize [Polynomial.isNilpotent_iff](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Polynomial/Nilpotent.html#Polynomial.isNilpotent_iff) to CommSemirings: if f is nilpotent then clearly its leadingCoeff (equivalently, the leading term) is nilpotent. But f is the sum of f.eraseLead with the leading term, so f.eraseLead is nilpotent and we conclude by induction on degree.
Nice ideas, thanks! So that this doesn't get lost, I copied your comments into #10539.

This is also true if `p = 0`, right? And `IsDomain` is enough.

Also, it seems more reasonable to assume `a ≠ 0` (for `a : R`) and state that `(p * a).natDegree = p.natDegree` (applying this to the leading coefficient is immediate via `leadingCoeff_ne_zero`).

> And IsDomain is enough

The problem is that we can't write `(leadingCoeff p)⁻¹` in a domain. Some parts of mathlib use `IsUnit (leadingCoeff p)`, which would be a large refactor to implement here. (I'm okay with doing that in a PR that this will depend on.)

Ah you're right. Then I suggest to prove (in a domain) that the degree doesn't change when we multiply the polynomial by a nonzero constant, and prove this version (for fields) using that.

Anyway `p ≠ 0` seems useless.

That result already exists: [Polynomial.(nat)degree_mul_C](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Polynomial/Degree/Lemmas.html#Polynomial.degree_mul_C). I've moved this lemma to the other `mul_leadingCoeff` lemmas and restated it in terms of that lemma.

```suggestion
theorem Monic.irreducible_iff_degree_lt {p : R[X]} (p_monic : Monic p) (p_1 : p ≠ 1) :
```
This is currently stated for a division ring, and here you suppose `K` to be a `Field`. Maybe this generalization applies everywhere in this file?
Everywhere in this section indeed!

```suggestion
theorem Monic.irreducible_iff_roots_eq_zero_of_degree_le_three {p : R[X]} (hp : p.Monic)
    (hp2 : 2 ≤ p.natDegree) (hp3 : p.natDegree ≤ 3) : Irreducible p ↔ p.roots = 0 := by
```
